recipe.title: Buttermilk Fried Chicken Fingers
ingredients: 1 small Spanish onion, cut into 1/2-inch thick slices
2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs, cut into 2x4-inch strips
1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon coarse ground black pepper
Homemade or store bought ranch dressing, for serving
deep fry/candy thermometer, two 13x18-inch rimmed baking sheets, 2 wire cooling racks
instructions: In a wide, shallow bowl, combine buttermilk, milk, onion, jalapeño, salt, and Tabasco. Add chicken, cover, and refrigerate for 24 hours. Preheat oven to 250°F. Set cooling racks over rimmed baking sheets. In a large bowl, combine the flour, granulated garlic, onion powder, thyme, sage, paprika, cayenne, salt, and pepper. In a large pot, pour in enough oil to come up to 2 inches. Set over medium-high heat until oil registers 350°F on a deep-fry thermometer. Working in batches of 4 to 5 pieces, remove chicken from marinade, shaking to remove any vegetables and excess liquid, and dredge in the seasoned flour. Fry chicken pieces, turning once, until golden and cooked through, 6 to 7 minutes total per batch. Transfer chicken to wire racks and warm in oven while frying remaining batches. Serve chicken fingers with ranch dressing, if desired.
